name: Tech Against Terrorism
slogan: Helping startups address the exploitation of their services
description:
Tech Against Terrorism is an initiative launched and supported by UN CTED that works with tech companies and startups to build capacity for preventing their platforms from exploitation by terrorists and violent extremists. At the core of it all is a focus on respecting human rights and freedom of speech.

This work feeds into our development of an online knowledge-sharing platform that will form a resource freely accessible to all organisations seeking help and guidance. All our work advocates the strengths of an industry-led, self-regulatory approach to tackling terrorist use of technology, and is informed by the emerging normative framework spearheaded by major technology companies. 

Along with UN CTED, we are collaborating with Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter, and YouTube to support the recently-announced industry-led Global Internet Forum to Counter Terrorism.

jobs.title: Web developer
jobs.description:
Tech Against Terrorism is a high-impact nonprofit working with the UN Security Council and the global tech sector, civil society, and national governments to support smaller internet platforms in tackling terrorist use of the internet whilst respecting human rights.

We're hiring a larger team developers to help us build tools to support the tech sector make better decisions about terrorist propaganda. At Tech Against Terrorism we have three pillars of activity: 1) Global outreach; 2) Knowledge sharing; 3) Applied data science and development to support tech platforms. As we continue to grow, we are working on developing new modules and tools for our Knowledge Sharing Platform to provide tech startups with practical support as part of our partnership with the Global Internet Forum to Counter Terrorism. 

We're excited by the impact our work has already achieved and have ambitious plans for our upcoming product rollouts. As part of this we are looking for a passionate, driven, and adaptable full-stack developers who want to help tackle terrorist exploitation of the Internet and safeguard human rights.

Responsibilities:
*	Develop and maintain the Tech Again Terrorism website and Knowledge Sharing Platform (including assessment tools)
*	Collaborate with data scientist teams in building web-based tools to help analyse terrorist content and its narratives at scale
*	Help set creative direction for our online and offline presence

Some things we consider essential:
-	A high bar for how things you build work and look, with an exceptional eye for detail
-	Practical experience with:
	o	Modern CSS and JavaScript frameworks such as Bootstrap, Foundation, jQuery, Angular, React
	o	LAMP
	o	Wordpress
-	A continuous desire for learning and development of hard and soft skills alike
-	Strong communication skills, especially with regards to articulating technical concepts to non-technical audiences as you will be working closely with our team of Analysts, Researchers, and Marketers 
-	Versatility; you may have to wear different hats, or deal with fast-changing priorities

Compensation, Benefits, and Perks: 
*	£30-40k salary (based on experience)
*	33 days of holiday (including Bank Holidays)
*	Cycle to work and pension contribution schemes

If this sounds like you, please send a CV and cover letter to recruitment@techagainstterrorism.org. Please note that there could be some international travel to attend conference to help explain our work to technical and non-technical audiences.

Location: Central London
